posts.cooked: when i simulate this code, my robot pose doesnt change

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: I suspect the encoder values aren’t changing.  You need physics modeling code that takes the motor inputs and calculates and updates the encoder values.  See DifferentialDrivetrainSim and Physics Simulation with WPILib — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

link_counts.title: Physics Simulation with WPILib — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

posts.cooked: I updated my code like this but still encoder values aren’t changing

posts.name: Görkem Akyüz
posts.cooked:
Hey there!

To tackle the pose estimation and simulation issues with your robot, here are some tips that might help:

Use DifferentialDriveOdometry for accurate pose estimation. Just make sure to update it with encoder positions and gyro heading.

Field2d is great for visualizing your robot’s position on the field. Keep that updated with your estimated pose!

If you’re looking for more accuracy, consider adding vision-based pose estimation with EstimatedRobotPose . It can really help correct your odometry with those vision measurements.

For debugging, try publishing info like encoder positions, gyro angle, and robot pose to `SmartDashboard. Keeping these updated during simulation can be super helpful.

Control your robot’s movement using ChassisSpeeds and apply those speeds to the motors, making sure to update their states accordingly.

Lastly, don’t forget to use the AHRS gyro to get the robot’s heading and update the gyro angle in your simulation to match.

By following these steps, you should be able to get accurate pose estimation and have your simulation reflect real-world behavior better. Good luck!
